gurmukhi: diRsit drs ilv gur isK sMiD imly Gt Git kws jl AMqir iDAwn hY
transliteration: Drisati Daras Liv Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay , Ghat Ghati Kaas Jal Antari Dhiaan Hai ?
translation: When a devoted Sikh meets True Guru, his vision gets absorbed in the sight/glimpse of the Guru. And then his soul recognises everyone as if He resides in all; like the sky/space resides equally in all the water pitchers.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv gur isK sMiD imly jMqR Duin jMqRI aunmn aunmwn hY
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay , Jantr Dhouni Jantree Ounaman Ounamaan Hai ?
translation: The union of a True Guru and a Sikh blesses the Sikh with the capability of remaining engrossed in the words/precepts of the Guru. As a musician gets totally engrossed in the tune that he is playing, so is the case of a Sikh's absorption in his Guru.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mn bc krm iekqR Bey qn qiRBvn giq gMimqw igAwn hY
transliteration: Gurmukhi Man Bach Karam Ikatr Bhaay , Tan Tribhavan Gati Ganmitaa Giaan Hai ?
translation: With the concentration of mind and Guru's words in a Guru devotee, he realises all the happenings of the three worlds within his body.

gurmukhi: eyk Aau Anyk myk bHm ibbyk tyk sRoq srqw smuMdR Awqm smwn hY ]63]
transliteration: Ayk Au Anayk Mayk Braham Bibayk Tayka , Srot Sarataa Samoundr Aatam Samaan Hai ?63?
translation: By the help of divine knowledge, the soul of a Guru devotee becomes harmonious with One Lord who is present in every bit of His creation. This union is like the merging of a river water in the ocean. (63)
